article.title: Panasonic Computers Prove Tough Enough for U.S. Air Force
article.author: George Seffers
article.text: Panasonic Solutions Company, Secaucus, New Jersey, recently announced that the U.S. Air Force has selected Panasonic Toughbook mobile computers for its rugged mobile computing requirements, including flightline, maintenance, mission, and support activities. The Toughbook 31 rugged notebook and Toughbook 19 rugged convertible tablet can be purchased as part of the USAF Quantum Enterprise Buy (QEB) program and will be delivered by Intelligent Decisions. Both mobile computers will be included in the QEB program effective immediately and ending Dec. 31, 2011.
